definition[0]: one of a class of shares where DIVIDENDs are only paid in a particular period of time after dividends have been paid on all other classes of shares
example[0]: After a three-year deferral period, the deferred shares become freely tradable.
definition[1]: one of a class of shares which do not pay DIVIDENDs immediately, but pay them later, for example when the company reaches a particular level of sales
example[1]: Management may take deferred shares which will convert into ordinary shares when performance targets are reached.
